The batteries last a long time.  I have only drained them once in a two day TV watching binge without charging them.  The only thing that I would change is the two second  hold time on the on off button.  The only additional thing that I would want is a separate charging base that I could put next to my chair, so I wouldn't have to get up to get them.  It took me awhile to decide if I wanted to spend $180.00 for a set of head phones, but I am glad that I did.  I would hate to do without these now.
Title: Helped with hearing loss

Review Contents: My previous headset was the Game One by Sennheiser, but I recently obtained a XLR microphone for recording, so upgrading my headset was a must.  I also own two border-collie labs that were constantly ripping my audio jacks out from my tower, getting wireless was a must. After weeks of research  I could not be more happy with my purchase, these are ASTOUNDING. The bass is so powerful I often find myself turning it off when playing games like Battlefield 1, it completely changes your gaming experience.I can hear sounds I've never heard before in games! The battery life lasts me a full day of use as I work from home 24/7. About 20-25 hrs of life. I place my headset on the charger every night before bed, so with my 5 months of use I haven't had it run out once yet.  Trust me, I was hesitant to spend this much on a headset, but once you put these on your head you'll never want to take them off!
Title: Best Wireless Headphones For Gaming

Review Contents: The RS 175 is a real dilemma.  The sound is very good for TV.  The German design is really bad.  It's as if no one in the company tried using the headphones.  To locate the buttons (volume, bass & surround) while wearing the headphones is extremely difficult & frustrating.  It is so bad that I was thinking of returning the headphones.  Then my wife came up with a great idea.  I placed a tiny felt "dot" (self-stick) on the VOL + button.  Now I have no trouble with the buttons ( I might end up placing another dot on the BASS button).  As mentioned by other users, the headphones fit is tight and they can cause pain in the jaw.  If this is an ongoing problem, I will have to return the RS 175.
Title: GOOD SOUND, TERRIBLE DESIGN

Review Contents: This headphones really deliver quality and i use them with my roland vdrums and it sounds amazing. The down side is they dont come with a 3.5mm to 1/4 converter so i had to buy one separately.Using the drum module i was able to adjust the pads/cymbals in the correct direction (left, center, right) and the surround sound really makes a difference. Also the bass sounds amazing when using the kick-pad.I really like my new headphones because before i was using a wired pair and that is really annoying when you are moving around the kit. And there is no lag in the sound that was my main concern when purchasing this headphones.
Title: Great with vdrums, no lag, amazing sound.

Review Contents: I am a retired instrumental music teacher. My ears have lost some of their acuity, maybe too many loud sounds in my professional  life, or who knows, maybe they are just getting old. Anyway, these headphones are alleviate all those problems, for me, and for others who are irritated by the television or stereo being too loud for them but still not loud enough for me. Comfortable on the head, adjustable volume and sound quality, and wireless. The perfect answer until technology comes up with hearing aids that actually work regarding clarity instead of just louder unintelligible sound. The only negative I have would be the need for a mute button. The volume level of some commercials, along with their content is not always welcome. I hope nothing happens to these headphones, they do such a great job and are perfect for my need. I have read some reviews that have said they seem too fragile and will not hold up. Well, so far mine have had no problem. My father always said, "Take care of your equipment and it will take care of you".  He was referring to tools and machinery of course but it was only because he did not have the luxury of our present day electronic technology. He also had hearing problems and would have enjoyed this product as much as I.
Title: Comfortable on the head

Review Contents: I am writing this review after 2 years and 1 week of ownership and use. Although the quality of the sound is very good, intermittent drop-outs have been a source of all too frequent annoyance even though the distance between my transmitter and my listening location is only 10-15 feet. The wireless signal is very easily interfered with and determining the source of the interference is an exercise in futility. Another complaint I have is the very poor quality of the material that covers the ear cushions. It tears quite easily so be prepared to replace the ear cushions (and you have to purchase the pair even if you only need to replace one cushion). Last but certainly no least, no sooner did the 2 year warranty expire than the transmitter's digital output abruptly stopped working altogether. And it is the digital, not the analog, connection that I always use. So the headphones are now totally worthless for my purpose after only 2 years of use.
Title: Very Disappointing Given the High Price

Review Contents: These are fantastic headphones.  I got these for watching my favorite action movies basically.  Living in a condo, I can't really crank up the surround sound that is needed.  These are fantastic, I set the surround sound on high and turn on the bass, and I am shook.Comfort Level = 10/10 for me.  Which is unusual, as most over the ear headphones give me an earache, these don't.Range = 10/10  I can walk anywhere in the house, have a couple walls between me and the transmitter, and no sound loss.Consistency of Transmission = 10/10 no burps, no glitches, perfect every time.Sound Quality = 10/10 I can feel the pulse pounding action with these.  Next best thing to being able to crank it up in your house.I was unsure if these would be worth the price, they are the most expensive headphones I have ever bought, and I am 100% happy with this purchase.
Title: Great Headphones, must have for movies/music when you can't crank the sound up.

Review Contents: Bought refurbsihed from The Sports Barn.  Looked like, works like new. Pre-charged batteries included, so wait time for using was reduced from 18 hours to a few minutes before full charged.  Previously owned the Sennheiser 120.  Audio was just okay, settings keep needing to be readjusted, and if  I forgot to turn them off, after a few minutes it would let me know with a loud hissing noise audible across a large room.  Upgraded to the SONY RF985 headphones.  Very good sound, comfortable, best long rangge listening of the three.  The Sennheiser RF 175, however,  has the best sound, best base, and only surround sound feature of the three.  If used with an optical cable, it does not automatically turn off the speakers . . . but you can turn the audio way down on the t.v. and adjust the audio independently on the headphones themselves for private listening.  With the RCA cable, the speakers on my t.v. could NOT be turned on at the same time on the 120 or 985 but if the sound level was not high enough on the t.v. (even though you could not hear it on the t.v.) the headphones on the cheaper Sennheiser and Sony would eventually just cut out.  The optical cable that came with these headphones seemed cheap.  I recommend purchasing an Amazon optical cable to replace it.  Others have reminded buyers to remove the plastic protective caps on the optical cable.  They're almost invisible.  But they do need to be removed.  Oh, and I suggest reading the manual . . .there are more switches and buttons on these headphones than any of the others.
Title: Refurbished, better than new

Review Contents: Never could get these to work. It might be me and probably is me but, I tried everything I could to get them to work. I did not return them because I felt it was more my fault than the fault of the headset. If I plugged them into the headset plug of my TV they worked fine but, all the sound went to the headset and no one watching the tv could hear the tv. only the one wearing the headset could hear. That will not work for us. The instructions said I might have to change the settings on my TV to make it accept the headset separately. Well, I am not that good with changing setting on TV's so, when I tried I almost messed up my tv and just gave up. Anyone need a like new set of headphones? lololol  I am sure for the price these are a good set for the right person not a 70 year old non teck savy lady. lolol
Title: Might be good if you are teck savy

Review Contents: Wow, do I love these headphones!  I got tired of subtitling every game I played just because the family was asleep.  I decided to shell out for these, and now I prefer them over my speakers!  Great sound clarity and good bass.  I don't play many FPS to compare it to, but from what I can tell, the surround sound is spot on.  Also, they do a good job blocking out external sound; it trickles through, but I would estimate 85% is deadened.  They are very comfortable around the ears.  I was concerned about the padding wearing down over time, but as far as I can tell after 9 months there is no difference in "puffiness."  Lastly, good battery life.  I just played for over 6 hours last night and they were still charged.  Highly recommended.
Title: Good sound, comfort and privacy

Review Contents: My husband is hard of hearing.  Even with hearing aids, he listens to our television at close to the highest level it will go (about level 48).  when I am alone, I listen to the television at about a level 8 to 10.  I bought him some Sony headphones but they weren't easy to use and the volume level wasn't there for him.  With these headphones, I can stay in the room with him to watch television and he doesn't have to ask me "What did they say?".  He can adjust the bass and treble according to what he is listening to and that helps him a lot.  I am very happy with these headphones and so is he.
Title: I bought him some Sony headphones but they weren't easy to use and the volume level wasn't there for ...

Review Contents: These headphones put out great sound and are infinitely easier to turn on than my older sets of Sennheisers, just push the button on the headset.  If I have any objections to the comfort it involves the sense that the phones are trying to squeeze your brains out, my ears get a bit tired of being pushed on. I have small ears so they fit inside the phone which really isolates me from my surrounding (including my wife), my wife did not like how her larger ears felt with the phones on, too pinchy.  It was a choice between these or the RS 195 with the adjustment for the hearing impaired, the price determined which set I bought.  I can hear the spoken word quite nicely with these headphones and since I do not own the 195's I will never know if the more expensive model is better for hearing the spoken word
Title: These headphones put out great sound and are infinitely easier to turn on than ...

Review Contents: Let's just cut to the chase; these things sound GREAT.  If you love bass, this will not disappoint.  The bass boost feature is actually quite good and does not create the feeling of an "artificial" bass.  Certainly, there is a DSP playing around here, but it sounds quite good; the bass rumbles, has good frequency range, is not muddy, and does not distort the other frequencies.  This is PERFECT for a movie theater type sound.The low surround sound feature is OK, it gives a bit more spacing and soundstage at the cost of some "aggressive" mid-rooted aspects of the sound.  The bass response (bass boost on) is still quite good with the low surround setting, although the high setting sounds overly reverberated and likely will never be used by anyone, ever.If you also want to listen to music, it sounds VERY GOOD.  Again, the bass flat out makes you want to slap your momma.  If you want an accurate, flat response, you probably want the RS 185, but if you want something that will melt your face off, you can't beat the RS 175.
Title: Yes, they are THAT good.

Review Contents: These headphones are everything I didn't know I needed. The picture made me believe this set would be more of a gray and champagne color scheme but it's actually a nice black/silver scheme so it's far from being unsightly, in fact they look amazing on a desk. I was previously using my pair of Beats Solo 3 headphones but I needed something that'd feel more relaxing to wear at a desk for hours on end. And the fact that these come with their own stand/amp/recharging station thing is absolutely incredible. Sennheiser has really outdone themselves again. I love German engineering because of that sense of practicality they have locked down. I hope they made keyboards and mice one day, too!
Title: Sometimes You Don't Know What You're Looking For Until You Find It

Review Contents: Really like these headphones.  They are so much more advanced than my 10+ year old Sony ones they replace.  The digital input is delightful.  Means can listen on headphones as well as others hearing the TV speakers. Like the Surround Sound feature.  Sheer quality of the sound is amazing. Great for listening to. Xmas musicals. Also reception while moving around house is great if go to kitchen to get a coffee or even hang out the washing.  So much better than old tech. Canâ€™t truly compare with alternative modern headphones but I have no regrets with this purchase.
Title: So Good

Review Contents: It was not until we purchased this item and opened it up that we found out this item can't be used if the recipient has a pacemaker.Would have been helpful had we know prior to the purchase.  Have no idea it's value as it was returned.
Title: It was not until we purchased this item and opened ...

Review Contents: Wow, move over Sony. Replaceable batteries unlike the newer Sony headphones which have hard wired batteries. Go with the digital input. Ear cups are easy to replace. Crystal clear when there is no sound and the surround sound and bass are a great added feature. Headphones are turned on from the headphones or base. I discovered from other headphone reviewers that this is not discreet 5.1, 7.1 or 9.1. There is just one speaker per side. If you want a discreet headphone you will have to go with a gaming headphone that actually have a few speakers per side. These do not lend themselves well for a home theater environment. The range was not as advertised and the headphones need to be placed on the sweet spot on your head. Listen nothing is perfect but these are really well made. Don't forget the extended warranty.
Title: Great virtual surround sound wireless headphones for a home theater system.

Review Contents: I give these headphones 5 full stars because they really make a difference in the quality of the sound.  Iâ€™m constantly backing up movies without the headphones, because even though I have the volume up loud, I canâ€™t hear everything they say, especially if the movie has music in the background. With the headphones, that isnâ€™t a problem.  I can hear everything perfectly, even with music, and I donâ€™t have to have the tv volume up loud, which my wife appreciates.  Comfort-wise I would give these only 4 stars, but the quality of the sound more than makes up for the slight discomfort so I definitely give these a 5.
Title: Greatly improves quality of listening.

Review Contents: My husband love his wireless headphone system. I gave him this for Christmas, he had picked out the brand as he had heard great things about Sennheiser. I like to keep the TV low when watching movies or shows, whereas he likes to watch with the TV blaring. This was perfect for us and I can still control the TV volume separate from these headphones.  He can now hear sounds off in the background of the film which he loves as he can pick up on more of the audio than listening via TV speakers.
Title: My husband love his wireless headphone system

Review Contents: I got my dad a cheaper model. It was loose on the head and would fall off and rubbed his ears which became an issue later. I upgraded to this model 175. It is over the ear and fits comfortably snug. He doesn't give compliments very often but loved this a lot better and said it was great. He is hard of hearing so a huge pro for him. Con is that since it's over the ear, he can not hear my mom whatsoever. She has to get his attention visually now. I guess a con for her and maybe a pro for him? Ha. Worth the money to upgrade for sure. Sound is way better as well and it's digital instead of analog since I hooked it up with that option.
Title: Worth the money and very comfortable / snug

Review Contents: To keep this simple, the Sennheiser RS 175 wireless headphone system is great and works as advertisedâ€¦when it syncs with whatever device you are connecting it to.My advice before purchasing this system, especially if your device options are limited, is to make certain your technologyâ€™s audio system outputs in a â€œlanguageâ€ (my word) the Sennheiser system understands. If it doesnâ€™t, Sennheiser tech support suggests you may need to purchase a â€œtranslatorâ€ device (also my word) to resolve the â€œlanguageâ€ problem.I initially connected my RS 175 system to a two-year-old Panasonic television. After trying each of the televisionâ€™s various audio settings I was still unable to make the headphones work in either digital or analog mode. To fast forward a bit, I then connected the RS 175 to a one-year-old Vizio smart TV that was in another room and it worked fine. I may have missed this potential connection issue in Amazonâ€™s Sennheiser RS 175 overviewâ€¦if so, my badâ€¦but it would have saved me a few hoursâ€™ time and anguish had I known this system isnâ€™t always plug and play.Lastly, I purchased my RS 175 system because I often have difficulty understanding the dialog when watching television. I hear the voices but sometimes have a problem determining what is being said. The Sennheiser RS 175 headphone system has eliminated this problem, and the digital wireless audio transmission is excellent throughout my house.  Iâ€™d buy it again.
Title: the Sennheiser RS 175 wireless headphone system is great and works as advertisedâ€¦when it syncs with whatever device ...

Review Contents: My husband had been using an older model of Sennheiser wireless headphones for years, but they finally died.  We bought these as replacements.  He is thrilled with them.  The sound quality is great and they are very convenient.  We use them plugged into the earphone jack on our sound system so my husband can watch his endless TV without disturbing me.  Using the earphone jack cuts off the other outputs from the sound system and leaves the house quiet - except for the reception through the headphones.He says these are very comfortable, block outside sound, and have good audio quality.
Title: Work well

Review Contents: I connected to my Samsung TV however whether I am listening to my PC plugged into my TV or my PS4 also plugged into my TV the sounds keeps going out periodically for split seconds - using either optical or audio cable. My $99 Sony headphones, which this was to replace, connected via audio cable does not encounter this issue at all. My set-up is fairly simple and I am less than 4 feet away from it all. Bummer.
Title: Drops too much

Review Contents: These headphones work great! I use them to watch TV. Bass response is fantastic. Voices are clear and easy to understand. Background noises and off screen sounds like doors closing and cars passing are crisp and clear. I watch Netflix a lot through a Roku player hooked up to a Yamaha receiver. I like these headphones better than my Klipsch 5.1 speaker system. The surround sound simulation works surprisingly well.Comfort: I wear them hours on end without sore ears or headache from excess tension.I've had no problem with reception from the base unit. battery life is all day plus some.
Title: I recommend these for watching TV

Review Contents: I own HD555's and HD558's...saw the glowing reviews and wanted a wireless pair of headphones figured Id stick with the brand I know. Too much bass for my tastes and the leather wrapped pads make my ears and head sweat if I even think about moving about the house with these on.
Title: I own HD555's and HD558's... saw the ...

Review Contents: The headset has great sound, but does not work with anything other than cable stations. I was willing to pay more for a good quality headphone, but I expected to be able to watch Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime or any other app. I see that others have had the same issue with Samsung 4K TVs, so I suspect this problem is specific to the brand and model of TV. Before buying check to verify it will work with your system. There are many postings from the community to help you determine if it will work with your TV. When it works, it's well worth the investment.
Title: Doesn't Play Well With Samsung

Review Contents: I really liked these headphones.  They were very expensive for my budget.  They worked very well. But before long the thin plastic covering on the ear pads and the padding under the crossbar started to disintegrate.  It is pretty much all gone now.  So technically they still work but I am very disappointed with the quality level exhibited.  I see now that this model has been discontinued and that the buyers of the  "replacement"  model can eventually order replacement earpads from the company if not Amazon. But don't think they will be cheap...that won't happen.
Title: Quality not up to standard set by the selling price.

Review Contents: The sound quality on these headphones it great. It obviously matters what the source is that you are using. Having said that I am using my PC as a source and it works great. It goes louder than I need it to and I like it loud. If I turn it louder than that then it will distort, but no one will use it that loud. The bass is pretty good. I would not consider it great. The rest of the sound is excellent. It will go up to as far as it says but just as an example I have trouble with it going through my fireplace. I can be on the other side of the house and it will still work as long as it is not going through metal like my fireplace. (2300 Sqft House) I have it in my room next to the window and I can use it in the entire backyard with no issues.
Title: The sound quality on these headphones it great. It obviously matters what the source is that ...

Review Contents: A+ comfortA+ sound. (Disclosure - not an audio expert)  Everything sounds good but the biggest difference between this and my cheap wired headphones is the bass.  I didn't fully appreciate how obnoxious the bass is on pop songs until I got these.Negatives:The sound will drop out for a fraction of a second occasionally.  I expect this is because I live in an apartment building with tons of wireless signals everywhere.The charging system is kind of awkward.  You want the base to be hidden out of the way somewhere but you need it someplace handy for easy charging.  But I can't think of much of a better way they could have done it.
Title: (Disclosure - not an audio expert) Everything sounds good but the biggest difference between this and my cheap ...

Review Contents: Bought a Sony Headset which feels better on my head, but it had hissing issues.  This one does not.  Crystal clear.  Does cut out on occasion in short bursts....but nothing to be overly upset with.  Two minor issues that did not meet the criteria established by the description.  One is the 300 ft connection....I only get maybe 10 ft away from the transmitter when outside.  Great reception indoors in a one bedroom apartment.  Second is the ability to tune the reception. which is built in.  The Sony I have allows this  and to the first issue, lets me go as far as the 45 ft range which is great when taking out the trash which so happens to be 45 feet..  But all in all I am very happy with it.
Title: Bought a Sony Headset which feels better on my head

Review Contents: I upgraded to these from the RS 140's that I purchased over 10 years ago.  Technology has definitely changed for the better.  Definitely set these up using the optical (Toslink) connection so you are getting digital sound.  The frequency response is quite amazing, the quiet parts are dead silent no hiss no hum like on analog TV headphones.  With the bass boost the sound is thunderous!  Range is not quite as far as I would have expected but then again I'm moving from room to room and not within direct line of sight to the transmitter...none the less from one end of the house to the other with few drop outs.  I also bought the HDR 175 Accessory headphone and was concerned about being able to charge only one headphone at a time...so far has not been a problem the charges seem to last a long time (many days) and just rotate the headphones on the charger.  Still order Panasonic Eneloop rechargeable batteries just in case...they are the best longest lasting rechargables available...be sure to check these out.
Title: Wow.......frequency response is amazing

Review Contents: I've been using Sennheiser RF 150 headphones for years.  They were "on the ear" while these are "over the ear", completely enclosing my ears.  An advantage is that they don't fall off when I bend over.  A disadvantage is that if I need to talk to someone I have to take them off, not just mute them.  There's a simulated "surround sound" effect, with two levels, that I don't find useful. I'm hard of hearing and wear hearing aids when I'm out of the house.  These allow me to hear the TV clearly, increasing the volume as necessary without annoying my wife, whose hearing is still acute.
Title: Great sound, easy to use.  Note that they enclose your ears completely.

Review Contents: Suffering from partial hearing loss over certain frequencies.  As a result, some conversation can be unintelligible, making it difficult to enjoy some TV shows and movies.  Since this device is far less costly than hearing aids, I figured it would be worth a try to see if it would help my ability to understand what I had been missing.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that IT DID MAKE A GREAT DIFFERENCE!  While it may not make up for all of the hearing loss, it is a vast improvement over listening to the TV's speakers.  One bonus is that I can walk around the house with them on after my bride retires, without disturbing her and not miss a word of whatever show I'm watching.
Title: Hearing loss?  Try these - you might be surprised.

Review Contents: Bought this with the extra set of headphones so my wife and I can watch TV and hear what's being said, without everyone else having to hear our shows. I have several other Sennheiser products, and the quality of this purchase is equally stellar. Easy setup and easy to use. Still playing around with the sound settings, but the sound from the headphones is clear and strong.
Title: Another stellar Sennheiser product

Review Contents: Purchased as a gift for my dad who is hard of hearing. Usually we either suffered with extremely loud volume or subtitles during movies and TV. Now he is able to independently control his volume in the headphones while we can listen normally through the TV speakers/surround sound. The sound quality of these headphones are crisp, clear and loud or quiet as you need them to be. You can adjust the different settings on the headphones to change the tone and the wireless function works perfectly.Easy to use, easy to setup, excellent sound quality.
Title: Excellent Sound Quality for a Reasonable Price

Review Contents: I hooked these up to a Sony STR-ZA2000es AV Receiver. This AVR does not have an optical digital out and the Smart TV optical digital out is in use to deliver sound from Internet programming to the AVR. I mention this as most of the hookup videos and instructions offered by Sennheiser cover using its Optical in. The AVR does have Zone 2 analog audio outs (standard RCA R/L jacks). Using a Y-Connector/Converter I connected the RS 175s via its 3.5mm jack to the Zone 2 outs. The AVR is connected to a good set of B&W speakers in the normal 5.1 configuration in the family room, but there are times when the kids/wife are sleeping and I wanted to enjoy great programming without disturbing them upstairs. The RS 175s do this remarkably well, and I can hear dialog and special effects with great clarity and quality. The surround settings give enjoyable 5.1 simulation and the bass boost without surround also works for enjoying music. I had need of the Sennheiser support staff for a minor issue, and they were responsive and knowledgable communicating via email. Great product, excellent service.
Title: Powerful Performance for Quality Programming

Review Contents: I should have bought these sooner, instead of using a cord with an older pair of headphones. They are very comfortable and screen out ambient noise. I can now watch TV at night when my wife wants to sleep without worrying about one of use tripping over a cord in the middle of the night. The other really fine feature is that with some high frequency hearing loss, at times I miss some of the dialogue when listening with the TV speakers. Now I can hear all of the dialogue and even some background sounds I never knew were there. On the down side they do get heavy and warm after a while. When I first bought these the sound was turned down so low I couldn't hear anything. It would be nice if there were visual feedback to changing the volume, but not life essential.
Title: Wonderful Upgrade to Your TV Watching Experience

Review Contents: These work just great as far as sound quality is concerned, but I bought them to use when watching TV and, in that setting, they are problematic.  Isn't really the fault of the headset, its just that (as on every TV station), when the commercials come on full-blast, its painful.  Can't really find the mute button in time unless you sit there with your hand on one earpiece.  Maybe a small remote rather than controls on the headset itself would work better (?)
Title: These work just great as far as sound quality is concerned

Review Contents: Wow.  Nice quality sound.  I can walk all over my small 1800 sq ft home and the signal is strong.Some have discussed how tight they fit.  I'm an average size man at an average weight, etc...  They fit snug, not too tight though.  i can look down and around and they don't feel like they'll slide off.I love the fact that they don't take any special battery or are difficult to change the batteries.  It takes standard AAA and a slight twist of the ear pads expose the spot to change them.  I bought extra AAA rechargeable batteries so i have the option to switch then out if i need too.I'm glad my homework and reading about these headphones steered me in the right direction.  I'm very happy with these.
Title: Very happy with these.

Review Contents: These headphones sound great.  For the first pair I ordered, sound cut out every 10 seconds or so - which is ridiculous for such expensive headphones.  Amazon replaced these (I love Amazon).  The second pair did the same thing.  As posted by a different user, the problem is due to interference in the 2.4GHz WIFI band.  When I changed the advanced settings on my wireless router from Channel 5 to Channel 11, the drop-out problem disappeared.  Otherwise, these would have been returned too.Sennheiser does a purely awful job of1) Designing headphones guaranteed to be immune to common WIFI signals,2) Admitting there's a problem, and3) Posting troubleshooting tips to fix this problemIf you can't control the WIFI that bathes the location you'll install these headphones (e.g. in an apartment complex) don't buy these - chances are they will fail.
Title: Great Sound With a BIG Flaw

Review Contents: I only gave 3 stars because these are not as strong as they advertise and after 30 to 40 minutes the signal gets interrupted and gets worst the longer you have them on. They say up to 328 feet but in reality they will break up a little in 24-25 feet. My main room is 24 x 48 my tv is in the middle to one side of the 48 foot wall. The transmitter is on a table 3' off the floor and when I go to the sink in the same room I get small breakups. They are good sitting in my chair 14' away but still the audio starts to break up after 30 to 40 minutes. The longer you gave them on the more breaking interruptions accur.
Title: Do not believe over 300 feet of head phone reception

Review Contents: These headphone don't provide the punch or imaging of a dedicated surround sound system nor were they expected to. However, they are a great solution for when you want to watch a show at elevated sound levels without disturbing the household.  Additionally, dialog comes through crystal clear and I imagine that they would be great for anyone with hearing problems. The headphones are very comfortable as well.
Title: Not a substitute for a good surround sound system , but.....

Review Contents: Thank you so much for these. I have a mother with dementia and these headphones have given me peace again. I cannot hear her carrying on in the next room at all anymore. These definitely have noise reduction built in and do an excellent job. They pick up sporadic sounds as well and muffle them some. The surround sound and deep bass are nice and I keep them on most of the time. Charge holds a long time. I just put back on cradle each night and they last easily the several hours I use them. Wonderful relief for me.
Title: At peace again

Review Contents: This (and a companion) were bought to replace older Sennheiser headphones. These are noticeably improved as they pair very easily and their simulated surround sound feature works great. I grade it down a star because the headphones are very heavy and become uncomfortable after little more than an hour. I hope they break in somehow, because this distraction IS a game-changer.
Title: These are noticeably improved as they pair very easily and their simulated surround sound feature works great

Review Contents: Build quality is superb, probably aluminum, comparing to my previous Turtle Beach P11. Don't personally like the "surround" feature. All it does is push the sound away. Plenty of bass. No need for the bass boost. I've worn them for I'd say 6 hours one time and that's when I got "headphone fatigued", as people call it. I bought refurbished model because it was almost half the price. I spend $106 and I think that is fair. $160 is a little pricey. It has a 3.5mm aux jack and fiber optics port on the back. Going the 6 hours I was talking about, never lost charge, so I don't know how long they would last. If you want premium build quality and the rolls royce of headphones, these are a good contender. Range, I was about 30ft away and as I moved, it cut out. When I stood still, it was perfect. You spend for everything plus the name.
Title: Fantasic everything

Review Contents: Easy to setup and use but I am familiar with my TV settings and menu so that helped. Sound quality is fantastic and no sync delay between audio and video at least not that I could notice.  If there was my TV has a setting to adjust audio/video sync but that wasn't necessary in this case.  I've used a cheaper version and that works as well but it was more difficult to setup and the audio occasionally cut out. So for me this was well worth the price.
Title: Easy to setup and use but I am familiar with ...

Review Contents: I like the rs175 a lot. These are an upgrade from the 170"s that I still have. The sound quality is exceptional with tight deep bass and crisp highs. The wireless connection is excellent and they are comfortable to wear so they don't fall off while moving around in my apartment.. I use these for watching movies and concerts so I don"t bother the neighbors. But, the operation time between charges is only 4 to 5 hours.  They eat battery time and take about 10 to 12 hours to recharge.  Other than that, I enjoy them.
Title: I like the rs175 a lot

Review Contents: I am really enjoying this headset so far after 3 days. The tower looks a little cheap IMO, and I don't like the Sennheiser logo on the side. Also, the input options are only optical or 3.5mm. Would really love to see bluetooth capability. As for positives: Really rich, wide-bandwidth bass for such a small platform. Mids and highs are also crisp. I can hear the individual tings of a high-hat cymbal. Surround sound leaves a bit to be desired, as when it's initially turned on, the sync between the headphones sounds like the same person speaking from two different locations. I'm not sure if I get used to it or the processor gets tuned the longer one listens, but the double-speak feeling goes away fairly quickly. Would be nice to see Sennheiser license Dolby, but this is a very nice surround mode.All in all, would recommend - as long as you have an optical output to truly take advantage of the capabilities of this headset.
Title: Decent headset

Review Contents: I had high expectations for these since I own an older model Sennheiser wireless analog set that I am very satisfied with. I found that the buttons on the headset are too close together and all feel the same. I had to take the headset off frequently in the beginning in order to change the volume because I couldn't distinguish between the control buttons. I'm not saying that Sennheiser should bring back the volume wheel but how about a bit of separation so that I can tell which button is which.Another problem is that the headband is too tight for a normal male head. After an hour or two my ears are aching from the pressure.On the plus side I do like the sound quality and they are good for a person with moderate age related hearing loss. The volume pause button on the headset is also a nice feature.
Title: Good product but could be improved

Review Contents: Much improved compared to the older model. Excellent for people llike me who have poor hearing. (i wear hearing aids). Even with aids I need volume louder than wife can stand. With these I can have the volume I need and not drive the wife crazy. Spendy, but worth every penny. I can work in kitchen and listen to programs/music without watching TV screen. I can move around the house, work in garage, Wonderful product.incredible sound.
Title: Excellent for people llike me who have poor hearing

Review Contents: It is finiky about the connection, it would work with my Sony TV but wouldn't work in the back of the Genie Mini box.  Also the sound quality is good but the range sucks. I was replacing an old set of Sennheisers that only has RCA connectors. After trying a RCA to Toslink adapater to no avail I had to throw down big on these. Super funny I can go all the way the the bottom floor of my house into the my laundry room (very far away in a 3000+ square foot house) and these start to cut out just outside my bedroom. Why would those older $59 specials have such range and these do not.
Title: Picky about Toslink setup and short range

Review Contents: Very nice. I was a bit apprehensive about buying an open package item, but these were in perfect condition and all accessories were there. The price being less than 1/3 of an unopened unit was outstanding. The batteries were taped together with scotch tape, so I suspect that they had been installed at some point.  It was probably a return.  The headphones themselves are comfortable and secure. The sound is great and the surround effect is dramatic, although I think I prefer it off.
Title: Very nice. I was a bit apprehensive about buying an ...

Review Contents: THESE HEADPHONES ARE AWESOME!!! Bought these for my wife so so won't have such high volume on the TV(she is getting a bit hard of hearing.) They are really nice. Great sound, comfortable to wear for extended time and set-up was really simple. The wife absolutely is in love with them. I have a set of Sennheiser earbuds I use for my MP3 player and cellphone and they are terrific which is why I decided to purchase these. You will not go wrong if you do the same. Thanks Amazon for super-fast shipping - you saved my sanity!!
Title: THESE HEADPHONES ARE AWESOME!!

Review Contents: I've been very impressed with this system. It turns on automatically without having to fiddle with a bunch of dials and buttons, and I can adjust the volume independent of the TV volume. This means that if I am on the treadmill and need the headphones to hear the TV, I can wear them and crank up the volume while others in the room can still watch the TV at its own volume. This is the main reason I bought this system: I want to watch TV on my somewhat noisy treadmill without waking up the rest of the house.The earphones are snug but comfortable. The self-charging system is easy to use. The build quality appears very high and sturdy. And the sound is outstanding - especially with the surround sound and bass turned on.
Title: Great system for watching TV without disturbing others, or at a higher volume than others want

Review Contents: Solves several annoyances of the RS 160 I already have - the off button on the cans remotely shuts off the transmitter and it has a nice bass boost too. It also allows a digital optical connection to the transmitter. These cans sound terrific and can give me all the volume I want without distortion and without sound leakage that disturbs my wife. I had to lower the sound settings initially - made my eyeballs rattle, but my wife in the next room heard nothing while I luxuriated in music.
Title: ... remotely shuts off the transmitter and it has a nice bass boost too

Review Contents: This is my third set of wireless headphones..I previously purchased the RS 170 and they worked well with 3  issues..One was the controls for volume etc. were awkward to use...I found myself taking the headset off to make adjustmentsThe second issue I found was that the RS 170's have a latency problem...If your TV does not allow you to turn off the speakersyou will probably hear an "Echo" effect.Third issue was Noise. I could hear static during lulls in dialog or music....Prior to the RS 170's  I bought the RS 120's. They were OK but nothing to rave about..Static was also an issue..Being I sucker for punishment I bought the RS 175's and BINGO...All of the previous issues were gone.These perform so well  a friend who wears hearing aids in both ears tried them and said he hasn't been able to hear TV sound this well in years.Best of Luck to all in making your decision
Title: TWO TIME LOSER

Review Contents: I've been using an older Sennheiser surround sound headphone the past 10 years, and these have far surpassed earlier models. Definitely worth the price if you want the best!
Title: A Real Winner

Review Contents: I am generally quite pleased with these head phones. The sound quality is very good. I tried out the surround sound and bass boost features but decided they didn't really add much, so I only use the basic sound that comes out of the phones. I originally had a bit of difficulty replacing the ear pieces after inserting the batteries....because I was trying to put the left piece on the right side and the right one on the left side! You do have to be careful to match them up correctly in terms of left and right! As far as comfort, the first few days, the head phones felt a bit uncomfortably tight, but they have loosened up enough so I now find them comfortable.The only negative comment I have is that you have to jiggle the phones and move them about somewhat when you put them back on the charging unit before you see the red charging light come on.It's a minor annoyance as I normally get them to start charging after a couple of tries. I think the charging design could be improved so you could put them on the charger just once and the charging light would come on immediately.
Title: good head phones

Review Contents: Charge lasts over a day. Stand is a wonder. My co-workers always have their headphones dying on them because they forget to plug the headset in at night, but with this headset I don't have to remember to charge them -- all I have to do is put them on the stand, which is my go-to when I want to put them up. I never forget to charge them because of the stellar design.Wireless range is decent. I can walk a room or two away before it cuts out.Sound quality is okay I guess -- they're better than my old $20 pair, but they don't sound like $200 headphones. I'm not an audio person though, so maybe I just don't know what good headphones sound like.Build quality is pretty bad IMO. The design of the headphone supports rotating the ear cups, but only ~5 degrees -- this could have been improved so that I could turn the cups 90 degrees to make it easier to rest around my neck, but it wasn't. The plastic on the outer face of the cups feels super cheap. The ear pads feel really flimsy and cheap as well. If someone showed me a pair of these, I wouldn't think they were worth $200.4/5 because even though build quality is poor and sound quality is meh, the charging design is amazing and makes up for those somewhat.
Title: Designed so you can't forget to charge

Review Contents: We have had two sets of Sony for years that I thought were good, but this set of Sennheiser RS 175 is super. It was easy to understand from the You Tube video which I watched the "unbox" and others. I had it up and running in no time and it has great sound and volume control. Really am happy with these. HIghly recommend. I'd buy the disposable ear piece covers to save the real ones form wear and tear.
Title: ... sets of Sony for years that I thought were good, but this set of Sennheiser RS 175 is ...

Review Contents: We recently purchased the RS175 - has wonderful sound - easy to hook up.  The only LITTLE problem we had was at first the red light, on the battery charger, would never go out even though the batteries were fully charged.  I called Sennheiser but they were closed due to bad weather - by the time they called me back two days later it had started to work great.  They said yes they had had a little problem with some with the red light not going out BUT once if it starts working (which ours did) then they kept working.  I would buy this again.
Title: Wonderful sound - comfortable ear pieces.

Review Contents: These are very well made headphones. I had two issue though using it for TV. The first was the sound, I could hear the background music of the show but could not hear the dialogue. The second issue is the bulkiness. I wanted these so that I could watch tv in bed while my spouse slept the night away. They were not comfortable while laying in bed as I couldn't  move my head left or right whatsoever.
Title: Issues with Sound and Bulkiness

Review Contents: These headphones rock. Bought these after getting a terrible set of Sony's on Amazon. The Sony's had terrible static (no matter the settings), terrible sound and terrible range. I own multiple high quality headphones ($400 +) and so I expect quality when I listen to music. If you are the same way, don't waster your money on half measures.  When it comes to being a audiophile, I've found you typically get what you pay for. Skip the $80 headphones if sound matters... these Sennheiser's are great!
Title: Bought these after getting a terrible set of Sony's on Amazon

Review Contents: We just purchased a second identical set, both work great in the same house on different channels, no interference or problems. Excellent headphone set. Function and sound are great for music, IndyCar races, TV comedy, everything. Side to side separation is outstanding. The various audio options are very nice. All turned off produce sound that is also impressive. It is really cool to switch the settings though. The result is almost like changing the microphone with no additional equipment. Bravo Sennheiser!
Title: We just purchased a second identical set, both work great in the same house on different TV's. Great Product Sennheiser!

Review Contents: The surround sound being unbeatable is the best I can say about these headphones. Hooking them up was difficult and Sennheiser's customer service couldn't help. One person told me I needed a conversion box so I ordered it and that didn't fix the problem. Another person couldn't understand why the first one said a conversion box was needed. Just before I was about to send them back I figured out how to hook them up with the help of an online help site. Secondly, the right headphone hurts my ear no matter how I adjust it and thirdly they sometimes intermittently cut out during streaming. But with everything bad I've said about these headphones I've kept them because of the incredible sound they produce!
Title: Fantastic sound but that's all!!

Review Contents: These headphones were much better than I expected. With the faux surround-sound you really will forget you're wearing a headset at all after a few minutes. Bass is pretty good and the blocking of external noise is excellent. I live in a condo, so when the furnace kicks on it can really sound like a jet engine in my living room. With these headphones on, I can't even hear it... I'll pull them off my head and realize the furnace is blasting and I had no idea.The only cons are that I don't think it blocks noise from escaping the headphones as well as I would like. If you keep it at a pretty good volume, people will be able to hear it without trouble. It might even disturb someone else in the room if they are easily annoyed. The second con is that they hurt my neck after about an hour of use. They feel fairly light in the hand, but I guess the extra weight on my head really has a greater effect on my neck than I would have expected. Be sure to try to support your head if you're going to use them for extended periods or take breaks if you can. Lastly, they make your ears sweaty... they is really no two ways about this... if you wear the for extended periods expect to have very sweaty ears when you take them off.Otherwise, they were well worth the money and I'd consider purchasing a second pair.
Title: Great headphones

Review Contents: For me the product is excellent so far, yes it is tight on the head when you first get it but I don't know how a manufacturer would get by that. Mine loosened up after about a week. Fits very comfortable now.  I saw one complaint about needing to turn it on, all of my previous headsets had on switches so no problem for me, it will turn off automatically. For me the sound it great, I can finally hear what the actors are saying.
Title: Works great for me!

Review Contents: They are unbelievable. I blew a whistle for over 30 years on a railroad; Therefore I am hard of hearing. The volume works great and with the surround sound you feel like you are in the theater. Before I had some sonys that were about a hundred dollars and I liked them a lot but there is no comparison between them and the Sennheiser.Easy to install and a must for hard of hearing. on the Sony I had the volume all the way up and still had some problems. Volume Is not near all the way up and I hear perfectly on the Sennheisers I am saying this because it is the truth as I know it.
Title: abosutely wonderful

Review Contents: Best investment ever for my husband who is confined to bed, deaf in one ear and hard of hearing in the other.  Now I can be in the same room/house and not be blown out from the volume of the TV.  My husband can not only hear clearly what is being said but can also enjoy the background music instead of it just creating more noise for him. If I want to be in the same room and also listen, no problem, I can set the volume so it is comfortable for me and he can still hear fine.  Put them in to charge when he goes to bed and they are ready in the morning.
Title: Relief for the entire family

Review Contents: Excellent quality headphone system as usual from Sennheiser. Value priced but great sound. Easy to operate controls and installation is easy as well. Headphones fit tight to block out ambient noise so the surround sound effect is very good. These headphones solved the delay issues that cropped up after adding an optically connected sound bar. Analog headphones suddenly became useless. Since these can be connected to the TV via optical cable the sound now matches perfectly with speaker sound so no more annoying echo when using earphones and speaker at the same time.
Title: Wireless headphones solve echo problem

Review Contents: Overall great headphones! Love the fact that it has optical and digital outputs, so I can connect PS3 and cable and just switch between inputs. I have been a Sennheiser user for more that 10 years, upgraded from RS130, which I have been using for 8,5 years and they still working! I have never even changed the rechargeable batteries! 5 stars so far, the only con is the cables supplied could have been a bit longer.
Title: Overall great headphones! Love the fact that it has optical ...

Review Contents: WiFi interference from other devices affect the performance of these headphones, causing the music to pop in and out. This is very annoying, but when the interference does stop, the quality is great.They can get warm when worn for a long period of time, but are a comfortable fit over the ears.A little pricey for the results not to be perfect.
Title: WI-FI interference

Review Contents: These have saved my sanity and maybe my marriage!  My husband is practically deaf and would play the tv so loud in our bedroom at night and I could not go to sleep. Now it is so peaceful in our bedroom when I want to go to sleep. He loves them, too, because he can understand the dialogue better.  Best gift I have ever given myself!
Title: because he can understand the dialogue better. Best gift I have ever given myself

Review Contents: Reason for two stars, expensive and can not make it work with my Samsung smart tv even by attempting to follow advice left by others concerning this problem. They work beautifully with my regular Samsung tv but not with the new tv, which is the reason I bought them so, I have invested a lot of money for nothing. The vendor I got them from was great, item as described, fast shipping, no complaint.
Title: An expensive monument to futility.

Review Contents: I've had these Sennheiser RS 175 for 9 months and they are the best wireless headsets I've owned.  I like them in every way.  They sound great, and are designed much better in my opinion that the earlier Sennheiser RS 170 model.  I own both.  Just a suggestion..... I purchased two refurbished units, and they were just like new, at about half the retail price.
Title: ... RS 175 for 9 months and they are the best wireless headsets I've owned

Review Contents: This works great. Using the digital output on a PC with a toslink cable. Sounds great with excellent clean bass and comfortable. Material is not as cheap as I thought it was going to be based on a few reviews here. Light, but good quality. It also has a great set of features and very intuitive. Check out the manual.
Title: This works great. Using the digital output on a PC with ...

Review Contents: Just got it but so far so good.  Great sound, decent bass response and surround effects, but I wish there were more control over them. The headphone can be hot with the closed design. The charge light is counterintuitive, turning red if you take them off the stand for even a second even when the're fully charged, and to determine charge level you have to take them off the stand and wait to see how many times the light flashes.
Title: Very nice

Review Contents: Outstanding surround sound quality and isolation. Easy set up and charging, doesn't take much room. Very comfortable to wear for long periods of time. Better sound quality than my BOSE Q35 headphones.That's how I watch TV at night. I bought it at AMZ for under $200, excellent value.
Title: Easy set up and charging

Review Contents: use it all the time now. I have some hearing loss and it's difficult to hear nuanced dialog from background music. These headphones allow me to hear it all as it should be..and they're very comfortable for longer periods of time.
Title: Use them every day!

Review Contents: Can't get them to work, setting them up - instructions said I had to buy batteries, ordered batteries - went to install them to find batteries in headphones - will not charge - installed new batteries - will not charge - unfortunately return date was much shorter than other Amazon orders
Title: Can't get them to work, setting them up - ...

Review Contents: Sound excellent, easy install, optic line is a plus and must haveOne thing can be improved is the foam could be softer
Title: Almost perfect....

Review Contents: When I purchased the headphones I was worried if one could listen using the headphones while someone else could listen the the TV without headphones.  I was very happy to find this was possible.  We have a relatively small house and  I am able to listen while muting the TV,  allowing others to continue their activities while I listen to my program.  I will also admit I do have some hearing loss and the adjustments on the headphones allow me to hear  without subjecting others to very loud audio.  So far I am very satisfied with my purchase.
Title: Very satisfied

Review Contents: I am disappointed with these. The sound quality is less than my Bluetooth earbuds. There are some frequencies that are severely underrepresented. But they last a long time and the recharger/dock/stand/receiver all in one is great. I don't know of anything better. But I hope someday there will be until then these are the best there are. Also the audio fluctuate every few minutes
Title: These are the best there is and thats sad.

Review Contents: I bought these headphones to watch TV because I couldn't understand each word and missed too much.  Amazing sound and comfortable to wear.  Highly recommend the RD 175 RF.
Title: Excellent sound when watching TV or listening to music from TV.  Highly recommend!

Review Contents: works better than expected! i am able to turn the volume off on the TV and up on my headphones. my wife can make all the noise she wants and i dont hear anything but the TV.  the settings allow you to adjust it to be the best for you. some shows i just cant hear what people are saying. these headphones fix that. the slight bend in the over-the-head part makes these sit perfectly on your head even while leaning back.
Title: works better than expected

Review Contents: I bought these for my 92 year old mother and she loves them. We at first tried the cheaper model that Sennheiser makes but she said she got too much static on them. These are perfect and so easy to hook up,  and the sound is loud and clear. My mother does have a little trouble with the on and off switch on the headphones but only because you have to hold the little button down for a few seconds before it turns on or off and the button is really small.
Title: Great headphones for TV

Review Contents: Love, love, love these things! Clarity and sound are perfect - but of course I do not try to "watch" TV while roaming the streets or visiting neighbors! Within my home, they are perfectly clear in every room. Comfortable (although ladies may need to remove post earrings), and not too heavy on the head. I couldn't be happier with them. They are exactly what I was looking for to watch TV in the middle of the night when insomnia reigns supreme. TV is on mute and I hear every whisper clear as a bell!
Title: Clear as a bell

Review Contents: Performed exactly as advertised.  I didn't read the connect instructions until after I'd installed it, but it was obvious how everything was supposed to be installed.  Nice crisp audio and wonderful bass even without the bass enhancement feature selected.  attractive base station/charger stand with led indicators of connection status and charging/full charge status colors.  very satisfied.
Title: Nice crisp audio and wonderful bass even without the bass ...

Review Contents: These headphones are a real boon here....I hear every word perfectly and no longer irritate my wife!!!
Title: Five Stars

Review Contents: I absolutely LOVE these! Not because I use them, but because my husband does! We no longer "discuss" the volume level while watching tv. If he has issues, he puts these on and we both enjoy whatever is on the screen. I am no longer affected by volumes that assault my ears!  I shredded the divorce papers! Woohoo! By the way, I did try them. They have a great sound, on headset volume control (had to turn them down since he set the sound for himself. Oy!) and they have pretty good range too.Heaven sent!
Title: Posted by the Wife (who is now VERY happy!)

Review Contents: Have used mine daily for over 6 months.  I think they sound great with my Dish TV and music sources.  I tried high end Bluetooth phones as well ( Bose QC 35 ) and these sound better, and more importantly have a much much longer range.  I like to do work while listening to talking heads shows and listening to CDs and streaming audio.
Title: Very Happy user

Review Contents: My wife just loves that I got this headset. I could have the tv turned up about as loud as it would go and still couldn't what was being  said. She can have the tv at any volume level she wants and I can have the headset volume at any level I want. The volume in the headset is no where near what I would have had the tv at. I have just two minor complaints.You might sweat around the ears a little bit and they completely block any other sounds in the room that you are in. Setup was easy, just follow the instructions including the one to charge the batteries for about 24 hours.
Title: Great Headset

Review Contents: Maybe I didn't read the product information well enough, but I didn't realize these headphones work in the same frequency range as my WiFi router, 2.4 GHz. I wouldn't have purchased this model if I realized that because l use a Nighthawk gaming router and it's got a nice strong signal. My concer would have been justified because the router does interfere with the headphone signal and the sound drops out every few seconds making them unusable.I emailed Sennheiser and they recommended this solution, from their web site: https://sennheiserusa.happyfox.com/kb/article/219-what-do-i-do-when-there-is-wireless-signal-or-wifi-interference . That did confirm 100% that my router is the problem. As long as the router is off, the headphones work beautifully and the surround sound was particularly nice.Unfortunately, the recommended solution didn't work for me. The router and headphones are about 8 feet apart and I don't have any options for relocating them that would give me more than another three or four feet of separation. The bottom line for me is I have to choose between my router and these headphones, so the headphones are getting returned.Please note that I do have another set of Sennheiser HDR 120 headphones that work perfectly. They don't use the same frequency range and I was hoping to upgrade them with these RS 175's. The 120s are several years old and still going strong so I just went back to using them.I gave these RS 175 headphones a 2 star rating because they simply can't be used in my WiFi environment. Given how common wireless routers are, I think that's a big drawback. If it wasn't for that problem, I'd have rated them 5 stars. If you don't use a 2.4 GHz router or if your router is a good distance away from where you use these headphones, you would probably love them.
Title: Can't be Used Near my WiFi Router - Returned

Review Contents: This Headphone could not be a better as a hearing device. I would buy these again. The improvements I would like to see would be 1 individual volume controls for each ear. My hearing is very different for each ear. 2 Knobs or some other switching device that have better feel for changing the volume. I have had other headsets but these are way better. They certainly work for me and I will get used to the volume control as they are the more I use them. The clarity is very, very good and that is very important for my poor hearing. Probably the most important.
Title: This Headphone could not be a better as a hearing device

Review Contents: A very good set of wireless headphones for watching television. It's much better than older Sennheiser analog models. The digital optical connection to TV is a big improvement over the older models (no hissing or static any longer). The placement of volume controls on the side of the phone as opposed to in the back is also a big improvement as the laying back with the phone doesn't mess with the volume. The set doesn't have Bluetooth connection to music devices however.
Title: A very good set of wireless headphones for watching television

Review Contents: I had a pair of Sennheiser 160's but when I got a new smart tv, they didn't work.  These are as good as my old ones.  The only difference I have noticed is that the distance I can go from the tv is less.  The sound clarity is great and I like the volume control better.
Title: Good replacement for my old phones.

Review Contents: Better than expected. Sound quality is fantastic. Movies sound great. Low lag is perfect for playing the guitar in the middle of the night. They could be a bit more comfortable but they arenâ€™t uncomfortable by any means. They could also be a bit cheaper. All that said, I would buy them again in a heartbeat.
Title: Awesome

Review Contents: I have had Sony and Pioneer wireless headphones over the years. These beat them by a mile and are the best wireless headphones I have heard. Perfect clarity and sound quality especially for dolby digital. I have the digital cable running directly from the hd dvr to the headphones. No interference. Very comfortable. Need to be careful with the little plastic tabs that hold the ear cups on. I broke one with only slight pressure when inserting the batteries, but was able to glue it back on
Title: The One to Get

Review Contents: This is a wonderful wireless system.  I had the old set 180 and this is a major improvement.  The audio quality is excellent and the wireless transmission for short distances is flawless.  My wife and I are elderly with some decreased hearing so we have two earphones.  I hookup to the TV through an optical out and can hear voices on most programs very clearly.  Each earphone can be individually controlled for volume.  While these are pricey, they are well worth it if you want to hear TV programs clearly and listen to excellent music quality.  The headphones are easily adjustable for large and small heads and the padding is very comfortable .I don't review many products but I would strongly recommend this especially for the aging population.  However this will likely not solve hearing problems with those who need hearing aids and are very hard of hearing.
Title: Sounds Great!

Review Contents: Excellent sound & great range. Only downside = controls on the headphones. Difficult to adjust sound with headphones on your ears. Up/Down buttons can not be easily accessed. Mainly column control. Easy to hit the wrong button. Should have been designed with ergonomics in mind. You should not have to remove earphones to make adjustments.
Title: Headphone Controls

Review Contents: After much research regarding wireless headphones for TV I selected the Sennheiser.  The sound quality is clear, the distance between the headset and TV is exceptional and the padding around the ears are so very comfortable.  However, I was disappointed that this set did not include a "y" adapter to hook it up to analog.  You have to purchase the adapter separately if you use the analog hookup.  We now own three sets of Sennheiser headphones.  My oldest set is two years old and it is still working perfectly with daily usage.  Good quality product.
Title: Great quality wireless headphone system

Review Contents: I bought this for my 93 y.o. father to replace one[also Sennheiser] that he had had for several years. This one is more complicated to seat properly on the charger and doesn't hold a charge as long when it is charged properly. I can't speak for use in other circumstances, but it's been less than a happy situation for my father.
Title: but it's been less than a happy situation for my father

Review Contents: Fantastic!I've been using Sennheiser wireless headphones for about ten years.My first experience was with the analog version, which worked great.  A few years ago I tried to upgrade to Sennheiser's first digital version (RS 170), but I hated it because it had a weird humming noise and the lights on the headphones were too bright.This is the second generation digital headphones from Sennheiser and they are fantastic.  Sound quality is excellent and everything works great.
Title: Great digital wireless headphones

Review Contents: They work great but the instructions could be improved. You have to hold down the power button for a few seconds. At first I thought it didn't work because it didn't power on. Once I realized it works you just have to hold the power button for about four seconds then there was no problem. I like it.
Title: Instructions so-so, product very good.

Review Contents: I bought these to replace a pair of Sony headphones that I use to watch TV in the bedroom while the wife is sleeping. I absolutely HATED my old headphones because I would constantly hear a crackling sound due to a bad connection (my bed is only like 10' from the TV). These headphones are AMAZING! The sound quality is excellent and there are absolutely zero connection issues. I love the ability to turn them on and not have to walk up to the unit to turn them on and connect them. The battery life is a lot better than I expected and I am able to leave them in my night stand for about 3-4 days while using them nightly. The buttons on the side of the headphones are easy to navigate without having to look at them thanks to the bump on the volume button. I read tons of reviews before I decided on these and I'm glad I spent the extra money on these.
Title: Great Connection and Super Comfortable

Review Contents: Awesome headphones!  The sound is phenomenal, sounds like I am listening to my home theater system.  Connection is fast and reliable.  The range is great, I can walk over to the kitchen and grab a snack without losing the signal.  The only downside is that they are a little bulky, but I guess that's how they give you that surround sound effect.
Title: Awesome headphones! The sound is phenomenal

Review Contents: I've had these about 6 weeks, and used them every day in every setting.  These are the best!!!  I'm hearing impaired so these really help me hear clearly at a level that is comfortable for me, while allowing my partner to hear at a low volume.  The surround sound is great watching movies and the clarity is amazing.  I can hear things I've never been able to hear before, like the voices in the background.  I'm picking up more from everything I watch. It's literally like being in the room and part of the conversation.  Total immersion in the sound experience!Highly recommended!!
Title: Amazing sound quality for the Hearing Impaired!

Review Contents: Headphones drops sound randomly this make it unusable. Going to request a refund. I look at the 1 star reviews there is a good number of users having the same problem.
Title: Headphones drops sound randomly.

Review Contents: If you have problems with the sound cutting out (even intermittently) is to check how close itâ€™s placed to your router. We simply moved the base unit to the other side of the tv and problem solved!We love the clarity of this new model. The one button turn on is a nice change. Turning on the base unit from the headphones instead of muttering while you get up to go turn on the base unit was a brilliant change.Great product! The last unit we had lasted us over 7 years so we have great hopes for this one. Iâ€™m sure weâ€™ll buy Sennheiser again!
Title: Your router will kill the sound! Simple to fix and well worth it!!!

Review Contents: I have received the package as promised through amazon prime.  The setup of the system was very easy - just have to charge the headphone up for a day and they are good to go.  So far the headphones and base station are working great.  The bass and surround sound buttons really enhances your listening experience (not a big deal using and figuring out the location of the buttons on the headphones for volume etc...as some have people have noted).  Biggest compliant is I now have to purchase another set of headphones for $149 for the wife so we can both watch TV without disturbing he kids while they are sleeping.
Title: Great Headphones....

Review Contents: Awesome!  Very poor hearing in left ear and can hear surround sound clearly.  Additionally, I am a very bad sleeper and I used to keep my husband up all night with the tv.  Now I use these headphones and he hears nothing.  One of best gifts ever!
Title: Awesome TV headphones!  One of best gifts Ever!

Review Contents: Sometimes I have trouble making out what is being said on TV so I thought I'd try these out.  Now I can hear every little pin drop in the movie.  The only thing I don't like is having to where head phones.  They seem to bother my ears even though they are made for comfort.  I have sensitive ears so I can't wear them for long periods of time.  Other than that the setup is easy and the clarity is excellent.  The batteries where charged in 16 hours as stated they would be.
Title: Excellent clarity

Review Contents: I bought these for my boyfriend who has a tendency to watch EVERYTHING very loud. These are a lifesaver - his life. ;) We ran into a bit of an issue with these after they stopped charging. We weren't sure whether it was the docking station or the headphones themselves - but no worries... we called Sennheiser and they immediately sent over a mailing label so they could troubleshoot the issue. Long story short, they replaced the defective system with a new one. Round 2: so far, so good! :)
Title: so good!: )

Review Contents: My wife has Misophonia (doesn't like sounds of people eating or repetitive noises) and I bought the RS 175 for her so when I'm eating crunchy things while we are watching TV she can put the headphones on so it won't bother her anymore.  She loves them and can't hear me eating anymore and we can both hear TV.Our TV only had one optical out so I bought a optical splitter but that did not work so sending it back.  I ended up using the optical out on the DVR for the headphones and it worked great.  I can hear TV without the headphones and she can hear TV with the headphones on.
Title: Works for people with Misophonia

Review Contents: I never use that word but it applies (so far) here.I've been experimenting with these headphones and and used them, so far, in two ways:1) I connected the Digital optical out from my Sony Smart TV to the digital optical in on the headset base.  This makes it possible to hear the TV, without bothering others, anywhere in the house and about 50' out in my backyard.  I can also listen to Pandora or Slacker (from the smart TV app) but sound quality from those two sources is pretty muddy .  This is a limitation of the source not the headset.  I believe, to conserve bandwidth, quality from most streaming sources is similarly reduced.Here is how I know this muddiness from streaming sources is not the headphones:2) I used an external DAC (Fiio) and took digital optical out from my Macbook to the DAC and then the Analog out of the DAC into the headset base.  Playing High res FLAC files on the VLC player is the best sound source I can currently produce and the sound is really wonderful on the headset.  I'm not enough of an audiophile to impress you with jargon but I can hear lots of detail, depth, and definition.  I only have about 10 hours on the headset so far and I'm told a "break in" period of 40 hours or so will improve them further.  This experiment bypasses the DAC which must be built in to the headset base (else you couldn't put digital in) so I still need to get the necessary pieces parts to put digital directly in to the headset base from the MAC.I think most of what sells headphones these days is boosting the base for lots of that BOOM THUMP thing.  These have a bass boost button if that is your thing but I don't really like it.  The surround button add artificial delays to simulate the little echos we don't really notice when listening in, say, an empty room.  I'm not sure I like it but you have three levels to choose from.Comfort:  The ear boxes on these headphones are big enough for my big floppy ears so they don't bother me in that way but they are a bit tight.  I'd expect they'll loosen up a bit with time but I don't really want them too loose as I intend to be fairly active while using them and don't want them to fall off.In any case these things are terrific.  I'd tried a number of very expensive wireless headsets and come to the conclusion the technology just wasn't "there" yet but these prove me wrong.All that's left now is to test their quality using a digital source in (hoping the built in DAC is as good as the other components) and, of course at this price, that they don't fail or the quality doesn't fade.I will definitely update this review when I've got more time on them.
Title: So Far I am STOKED!

Review Contents: Couldn't wait to kick out my old Sony headphones. All attempts to replace the batteries in the Sony failed. The Sennheiser uses standard triple A rechargeable batteries. I love it. The sound is fabulous. I couldn't make the optical connection work, but I don't blame it on Sennheiser after learning there are several different protocols for this kind of connection. I wish it could be standardized.
Title: I love it. The sound is fabulous

Review Contents: These are GREAT! No problems with them yet. Only real gripe here would be you have to make sure you get the headset on the base properly or it won't charge. I have used regular akaline batteries with it but they don't last but one 4 hour session. These sound great too. I found that turning off the bass and surround on them makes for much better listening.
Title: Perfect Wireless Headset!

Review Contents: very pleased. sound clarity is fantastic. I am hard of hearing but can hear the tv clearly. I have to say that it does not always sit on the cradle correctly for charging, but all I have to do is jiggle it a little and its fine, no big deal. also they are a bit heavy. no big deal there either. they have worked great with out a problem and I have had them for 3 months. I use them every night for about 6 hrs. I would deff buy them again and would recommend them to a friend
Title: very pleased. sound clarity is fantastic

Review Contents: Like most Sennheiser products, this one is pretty damn good. They have good sound and good range, something my previous Pioneer headphones did not. I don't need all the bells and whistles, as my hearing is severely impaired. What I need is just good old fashioned volume and clarity. These provide that.
Title: Works well for this severely hearing impaired guy.

Review Contents: The unit does not work more than 20 feet from the transmitter.
Title: Sennheiser RS 175 RF Wireless Headphone...

Review Contents: Great headphones, but:it should come with both an optical and coaxial digital input.  Most of my devices had coaxial digital outputs.  I finally shuffled all my electronics around and used my older Blue Ray player that had an optical output.
